channel.title: Formulas :: Better BibTeX for Zotero
channel.description: Note: a number of functions below talk about the author’s lastname; you can read that as “when available”. If you have the name as a single-field name (for entities like International Business Machines or Aristoteles), Zotero doesn’t have a last name, and the full single-field name is taken instead. Functions auth(n=0, m=1, creator='*', initials=false)The first n (default: all) characters of the mth (default: first) author's last name. parameter value assumed when not provided valid values n the number of characters to take from the name, 0 = all 0 number m select the mth author 1 number creator kind of creator to select, * selects author first, and if not present, editor, translator or collaborator, in that order. '*' ('author' | 'editor' | 'translator' | 'collaborator' | '*') initials add author initials false boolean authAuthEa(creator='*', initials=false, sep='.')The last name of the first two authors, and ".ea" if there are more than two.
